definition: (literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: She did not attend the hearing and was not represented in court.
sentences.chinese: 她沒有出席法院和參加聽證會，也未能向公報發言。

sentences.english: Gates' performance during the hearing didn't sway the powers that be.
sentences.chinese: 蓋茨當時在聽證會上的表現沒能改變當政者的看法。

sentences.english: Suspects accused of trying to carry out a bomb plot against New Yorks appeared in court.
sentences.chinese: 被指控密謀試圖炸燬紐約猶太教堂的疑犯出席聽證會。

sentences.english: Lawyers for warwickshire, arrange the divorce hearing, let him go with barriss.
sentences.chinese: 律師給瓦立阿安排離婚聽證會，讓他和芭麗一起去。

sentences.english: A pre-inquest hearing is due to take place on January 20.
sentences.chinese: 關於此事初步聽證會將於一月二十日舉行。

sentences.english: Then he was notified that the shooter was up for his parole hearing.
sentences.chinese: 然後，他被告知將會爲那個殺人犯舉行假釋聽證會。

sentences.english: This pass will privilege you to attend the closed hearings.
sentences.chinese: 有了這張通行證你便可以出席不公開的聽證會。

sentences.english: The version in the GOP-dominated House has not yet been given a hearing.
sentences.chinese: 共和黨主宰的衆議院還未對此舉行聽證會。

sentences.english: Now, Congress is revving up ahead of a high-stakes hearing.
sentences.chinese: 國會正加緊籌備一場攸關重大的聽證會。

sentences.english: He attended those hearings everyday, cross-examining new witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 他每天仍舊參加聽證會，和新的證人對質。

sentences.english: Shame on you, Toyota, ” Rhonda Smith, said at a congressional hearing.
sentences.chinese: “豐田真可恥”，朗達史密斯在國會聽證會上說。

sentences.english: This hearing was a major step forward in getting the bill passed.
sentences.chinese: 這場聽證會向法案的最終通過邁出了重要的一步。

sentences.english: During the brief hearing, Stiles only said he can not afford a lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 在簡短的聽證會上，斯代爾之說了自己請不起律師。

sentences.english: The hearing started, he raised his left hand to pay tribute to the gallery.
sentences.chinese: 聽證會開始前，他舉起左手，向旁聽席致意。

sentences.english: This is in the university hearing officer passionate strenuousness speech.
sentences.chinese: 這是中校在大學聽證會上慷慨激昂的演講。

sentences.english: The closed-door hearing, which lasted three hours, did not resolve the dispute.
sentences.chinese: 這次三個小時的閉門聽證會並未解決問題。

definition: to swear the oath of office
to call a conference/to convene a meeting
lower house of bicameral assembly/House of Representatives (USA)/Chamber of Deputies
to ask sb to resign from a post
